items.title: Once a Model City, Hong Kong Is in Trouble
items.abstract: When the British left 20 years ago, Hong Kong was seen as a rare blend of East and West that China might seek to emulate. Now, increasingly, it’s a cautionary tale.

items.title: The Mexico City Model of Abortion Care
items.abstract: Why the city may be a blueprint for progressive American states.

items.title: What Makes Lagos a Model City
items.abstract: Across the developing world, municipalities can offer a future of better governance.

items.title: Merger in Brooklyn Is an Alternative to City’s Small-School Model
items.abstract: A decade after a large, struggling middle school was shut down and replaced with two smaller ones, the Education Department is putting it back together and is likely to combine several others.

items.title: Reader Idea | Creating Architectural Models of Literary Themes
items.abstract: Using a Times article about a similar project as inspiration, high school students studying “Catcher in the Rye” create architectural models to convey their understanding of the novel.
